intro: Nesaea jaegeri, commonly known as the Jaeger's nesaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Nesaea jaegeri thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
